content:
Diagnosis:
Pineal germinoma
Diagnosed March 2024
PLAP positive, AFP negative
No evidence of CSF or systemic metastases

Presenting symptoms:
Headaches and diplopia for 3 months
Mild ataxia
No endocrine symptoms

Investigations:
MRI brain 12/03/24 - 2.8cm pineal mass with obstructive hydrocephalus
CSF cytology negative for malignant cells
Spinal MRI - no drop metastases
Staging CT - no systemic disease

Treatment to date:
15/03/24 - Endoscopic third ventriculostomy for hydrocephalus
20/03/24 - Stereotactic biopsy confirming germinoma

Current situation:
Improved symptoms following CSF diversion
No new neurological deficits
Performance status 1

Plan:
For standard dose cranio-spinal radiotherapy 24Gy in 15 fractions followed by boost to primary site to 40Gy
Radiotherapy planning appointment arranged for next week
Weekly review during treatment
Baseline endocrine assessment arranged

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows 2.8cm pineal mass with obstructive hydrocephalus
CSF cytology negative for malignant cells
Spinal MRI shows no drop metastases
Staging CT shows no systemic disease

patient_facts.value: MRI brain 12/03/24 shows 2.8cm pineal mass with obstructive hydrocephalus

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed pineal germinoma presenting with raised intracranial pressure. Improved following CSF diversion, now for definitive radiotherapy
Improved symptoms following CSF diversion, no new neurological deficits
Radiotherapy planning appointment next week with weekly review during treatment
